titleStmt.title: A physical treatise grounded, not upon tradition, nor phancy, but experience, consisting of three parts. The first, a manuduction, discovering the true foundation of the art of medicine. Second, an explanation of the general natures of diseases. Third, a proof of the former positions by practice. By William Russell, chymist in ordinary to His Majesty.
titleStmt.author: Russell, William, 1634-1696?

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for John Williams at the Crown in St. Paul's Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: The words "first .. practice." are connected by a left bracket on the title page.
Includes index at end of text.
Caption title on pg. 1: A manuduction, discovering the true foundation of the art of medicine.
Caption title on pg. 55: Of the general nature of diseases.
Caption title on pg. 70: A proof of the former positions by practice.
Reproduction of the original at the British Library.

place.placeName: the Crown in St. Paul's Church-yard
